item.title: Anne add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Anne add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Anne add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Anne add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Anne add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "It is sometimes easier to be happy if you don't know everything." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Anne add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Anne add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Life is unjust and this is what makes it so beautiful. Every day is a gift. Be brave and take hold of it." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Anne add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Anne add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Anne add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Anne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anne add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "Humankind cannot bear very much reality." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Anne add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "Walk, first, through the fire, then philosophize..." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Anne add a quote by Jean Sasson
item.description: "Poverty can turn a person into a flaming torch for change and revolution, without which mankind would come to a standstill." -- Jean Sasson

item.title: Anne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anne add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Anne add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Anne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Anne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Anne add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Anne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Anne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Anne add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Anne add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone ought to be." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Anne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance." -- Oscar Wilde
